page.title: 05Farming 4
page.content:
{ Bridge Farm}is {200 years old}being originally a small cottage which has been extended over the years. It includes{18 acres}of land and is run by the husband and wife owners and 1 full time employee. They own{100 chickens}that produce about 90 eggs a day, which are sold in their small farm shop. They also keep sheep, horses and pigs but do not breed animals. Calves are purchased and reared and then sold for meat to dealers. This is very much a working farm and disasters like{fowl pest}, which struck 15 years ago, are feared.
These 3 farms are typical of the farming that now takes place. Few crops are grown, and even Hazelhurst Dairy Farm has recently changed to concentrating on beef cattle.
